comments.body: This would also probably be useful in creative for games and things

Old minecraft or peaceful mode.

Jokes aside, I think this would be something like an unchangeable game setting than a toggle-able setting, depending on each save or server. Kinda like how you can't change the difficulty setting in Hardcore mode. You create a world, go into advanced options, toggle on the setting for Classic Healing (description: No hunger bar, heals by eating food), add a bunch of gamerules for the ones wanting to customize it, etc.

Also if you have cheats you can toggle it on and off with it as a gamerule setting.

 

I think this is much better.

you just have to make this command:

/effect [player name] minecraft:saturation 999999 255 true
YES i hate it without mobs on peaceful

I really like the farming aspect of the game. I do not mind the hunger feature of the game for health regeneration etc. However, I do not like to play with mobs on. Currently the only way to get hunger to turn on is to have the mobs on also. That makes farming useless. bummer. I would suggest a toggle switch to turn on hunger like the way you can turn on "keep items on death". 

Thanks

PLEASE Both in survival play and in creative making "games" for friends the hunger bar is so annoying to account for. 

Please make it a toggle, preferably between the old system and current system. i.e. old system where food healed you instead and there was no hunger bar or the current system

I can't believe this has never been fixed. It really makes you wonder how a game with such a large budget from a massive company can have so many issues open for YEARS,

Thanks for your contribution.

I don't see why armor can't be swapped by right-clicking ("use" key) the same way equipping works. It would make it so much less hassle to swap out your diamond boots for golden boots when going into the nether (or vice vers)  just using an armor stand and an item frame.

E.g.

  1. Place your sword (or any other tool) in an item frame. This is to temporarily give you a free hand.
  2. Right-click the golden boots on the armor stand to pick them up.
  3. Turn away from the armor stand & right-click to swap your boots.
  4. Right-click the armor stand again, this time putting your diamond boots on the armor stand.
  5. Left-click the item frame to take back your sword/tool.

This would be faster and more natural without having to use the inventory GUI.

Please add it!
Yes! Swaping chestplates and elytra by just rightclicking on them when held in the hotbar. Just like we normally equipe them when there is an empty spot.

If you can swap items between hands just by pressing f, you should be able to swap chestplate and elytra (or other types of armor) just by right clicking imo. Huge oversight imo and I hope it gets added.

It is a really good feature in bedrock edition , and helps a lot during pvp If this feature would actually come in java edition then while falling from a high place , you could quickly swap to elytra ,Please add this to java Edition It would be a LIFESAVER
As mentioned here already, this is available in Bedrock edition. It's a very useful feature and I was shocked to find it was not already in Java. this is another Parity feature

I've lamented about this so many times, you have no idea. We have Minecraft on just about every system you can think of. What I most like about the console versions (PS4 for example) is that you can switch between headphones and the TV just by plugging your headphones in or out of the controller. And if you have wireless ones you can do the same thing by switching them On or Off. 

I play primarily on the PC. And this is a VERY irritating issue for me because I am disabled, and spend a lot of time on the computer I have several different types of headphones (mostly for comfort reasons, but there are other reasons as well). And if I want to switch between wired headphones, my wireless headphones, or my TV speakers... I have to close the entire game and restart it. It's annoying when playing single player and INFURIATING when playing online or LAN.

I know this is a limitation of the operating system, for a program that is running to switch audio devices. But if it was built in to the game to allow us to do this it wouldn't be! 
I DO know it's possible, because some other games I've played allowed you to switch audio output/input devices while the game was running.
Please Just add some way to change output or update audio device. This would be worth a butt ton of diamonds.
This is a good idea!
I agree to this! I've been facing the same drawback recently and whew, I'm not alone!
please do it
while touch screen is generally a degraded performance over regular controls, I would rather have more play styles than just a controller.

We need a Nintendo Switch Pro Controller Option for The MCPE Edition on Android Devices, I want it to be COMPATIBLE but the App Itself isn't compatible with Nintendo Switch Controllers/ PS4 Controllers

Moved to proper category.

Of course, if you're thinking of a command, please move it to that category instead. With no information other than the basics here, we're just making a best guess based on context.

Thanks for your contribution.
It would be nice to have a graphic setting that does this :)

I'd second this but with a different approach: currently Minecraft has implemented greater render distances but lost the fog that was in older versions, say betas or early 1.x.


What you see is either crisp like it was in front of you or either very foggy near the edge of the render distance. It's easy to notice this in any map flying up and looking at the edge: you see perfectly for 90% of the screen then there's a really step fog that grays out into nothing only at the very edge.


This approach isn't ideal as it doesn't help with perspective and doesn't imitate the real world were atmosphere does whiten up farther objects, make them less saturated etc. Check out articles on atmospheric perspective to get what I mean.

Implementing a fog slider would work like this: with 0 you have literally no fog, all is visible till the edge of the render, increasing values stretch the fog from render edge to your current position, say 50 would mean halfway to you position, with 100 fog starts literally from you nose.

This won't affect much current gameplay if you implement the fog linearly increasing from starting point to the edge, so even with 100 setting the first chunks will look the same but halfway trough it will be much more noticeable, farther it will even hide things and blend to the border.
Heck yes!
Yea I agree with you, is so troublesome when you know Minecraft involved alot of chest filled with random bits of item everywhere.
As someone who likes to organize items alphabetically, I find it extremely tedious to do it manually, and I think this is a long overdue feature.
This feature already exists in the Nintendo Switch version, so it can / should be easily implemented on all other versions.
Yes, great idea!! Would also be helpful if you can sort by type as well.
I don't understand.

To clarify, when I scroll my mouse wheel, the quick-select bar selection picks the selection on the opposite side of what I expect. I know the way Minecraft does it is standard in most video games, but for some reason my brain can't get used to it, and so I would like an option to invert it. Just like some people need to invert the camera controls or they get frustrated, so it is with wheel selection for me.

i love the scroll wheel in every update 1.8,1.12  and even the first edition of Minecraft, but when 1.13 came out it was all messed up. Now the sensitivity on the scroll wheel makes it so it does not work half the time, and this is not good for PVP in java. ):
There is a sensitivity option.
YES I've even tried adding scripts but I'm not experienced and can't get it to work.  I really wish there was a setting for this because it really messes me up in the game and feels uncomfortable.

While trying to find a way to reverse the scroll direction I've come across posts going back as far as 7 years.  How is this not a thing yet?  I'm not a coder by any means, so is it that hard to implement?  You can invert the mouse itself for looking up/down, why not the scroll wheel?

Yes please!  I use a trackball that has the mouse wheel mounted on the left side.  In this orientation, the default hotbar scroll direction is opposite to the direction the mouse wheel turns.  It is incredibly frustrating.

So many other games allow us to rebind the mousewheel directions, please add this option to Minecraft. Mojang, I'm begging you! Save my sanity!

I'd also like this very much, please! I recently purchased Bedrock edition and was disappointed to find out it did not have the toggle for this in the settings. Due to my health issues, this effect always gives me heavy vertigo, and I cannot avoid because I need to go into the Nether for important resources!

While looking away from the screen reduces the dizziness, I still need to look back a bit as the screen is distorting to see if I arrive in the other side of the portal yet, so it's basically unavoidable.

I believe the change will make playing Minecraft the standard way a happier experience for everyone physically affected by this, even though we are only a minority of all Minecraft players. Because I love Minecraft, I want to fully enjoy the game without risking my health over. Thank you!

Yes!! Please!! Gosh, I am so tired of getting woozy every time I go to the Nether! I get migraines and general disorientation with those kinds of effects, and I don't want to make my friends go to the Nether to do my chores for me because I literally can't withstand the Nether portal screen animation more than a few times in a row.

Please, Mojang. Please.

Seriously, and just add on any and all accessibility settings that are present in Java NEED to be in Bedrock. Part of the reason I stay on Java whenever I can is the accessibility. PLEASE MOJANG DO IIITT!

Some bedrock texture and mash up packs also need to have their music fixed or redone, as their track lists havenâ€™t been updated to account for the new vanilla tracks introduced in recent years. For example, some older texture packs (ex. the Nintendo-exclusive Mario pack) used to have their own music for the nether. However, the texture pack track lists werenâ€™t updated when the nether was given new music in the nether update. As a result, these packs have lost their exclusive music tracks for the nether.

I agree, it's really inconvenient to drag and drop the same files every time I create a world. It should work like resource packs, you drag and drop once, and then every time you create a world you can go to the data pack screen where you can select them. You should also be able to access the screen in-game, not only when creating a world.

I was about to suggest it, I would consider it being .minecraft/datapacks something like resourcepacks have then when creating a world it would show the list of all datapacks in there (maybe add little search bar?)

This is a must have. As an avid datapack user and a "new world every day" player, it's extremely inconvenient to need to download or move a datapack for each new world. It should be an extremely simple implementation and if we're being completely honest, it's surprising that the developers didn't include it by default as it would have been most logical.
This is very important and should be looked at as they are reworking ui

I strongly endorse this. Currently it's very annoying to have to copy and paste datapacks into each world separately. It makes it too easy to lose the datapacks if you absentmindedly drag and drop it, and then you have to download them again. There should be an intuitive way to access them within the game. Vanilla already provides two test datapacks which are available any time you start a world, so I don't see why downloaded datapacks can't be stored in a way that they can be accessed from that same list.
I'm surprised this wasn't added when adding datapacks at world creation was added. Seems like a no-brainer to me.

They added this with other accessibility features in some update. All of the other features can be toggled on and off in the accessibility settings, and I really hope they add this new tab function to the list of things that can be toggled on and off. (Until they fix this, I found a quick fix if you're interested. If you have a keyboard with a macro program, you can set your inventory key to some unused key, and set a macro on your tab key to press whatever unused key you bind your inventory to. For instance I have a Razer keyboard and have a macro using Razer Synapse to make my tab key press P. Which allows me to use tab to open and close my inventory. Really hope they fix this though.)

Entering a scaffolding resets the sneak, fly up (also scaffold up), fly down (also scaffold down) buttons.

This used to not happen but the scaffold up/down buttons would be ontop of where my crouch/sneak button is.

Solution: make the fly/scaffold up button be the same button as the jump one and make the fly/scaffold down button be the same as the crouch button. (And fix them resetting)

jun 23,2024 13;53 what a good game

The new jump buttons and D-pad are inferior to the old ones both stylistically and functionally. The change to the visual design is okay, but the hotbar stayed the same making it look inconsistent. Between the old and new ones, I prefer the old visual design. The real deal-breaker is the changes to functionality. The default locations of the jump and movement buttons was moved away from edges of the screen, which is makes them uncomfortable to reach for. The ability to customize the location of the buttons is cool, but I'll never get them exactly where they were. My 2 biggest complaints are with the flight mode buttons and hotbar, though. The button for descending and exiting flight mode used to be in the same relative location as the jump button, but it was moved to be below it, leaving an empty space between it and the ascend button. This change really messes with my muscle memory; I always instinctually tap in between the new flight buttons because that was where the button used to be. I also want to mention the hotbar. It doesn't look any different, but it feels a lot less sensitive. For some reason, it doesn't register when I tap it directly and instead it places a block, which is really annoying. It only selects if you only tap the lower half of it. It's really annoying.

TL;DR, the new D-pad controls are a total downgrade. If you're not going to scrap them entirely, I'd at least like it if you added a classic control mode that brings the old controls and defaults back.

To follow up on my other comment, I have some thoughts on the visual design changes. Counterintuitively, the 3-D-looking designs of the new D-pad and other controls feel worse to use than the 2-D-looking old ones. The implied depth of the new buttons causes confusion about where the boundaries of the buttons are. Is it just the flat "front" of the button that registers input, or is it the entire icon? The flat, sharply defined edges of the old buttons didn't have this problem. In general, I don't like the visual design changes that the game has been receiving, and I think they remove some of the game's original charm.

The new UI is incredibly difficult and frustrating to use, I especially struggle in water trying to ascend streams, often falling out of the water and dying. I didn't have that problem before.
I even tried moving the controls but it doesn't help. The new UI issue just makes the game less enjoyable to play.
